metadata.title: Convert Celsius to Kelvin – Temperature Converter
metadata.description: Convert temperature from Celsius (°C) to Kelvin (K), essential for physics and scientific calculations.

introduction: This converter transforms temperature from Celsius to Kelvin, enabling scientific temperature calculations.
Kelvin is the SI base unit for temperature. All physics and chemistry calculations use Kelvin.
This converter uses the relationship where K = °C + 273.15.
methodology: To convert Celsius to Kelvin: K = °C + 273.15. For example, 0°C = 273.15 K, 25°C = 298.15 K.
Kelvin is an absolute temperature scale with no negative values. It starts at absolute zero.
Scientific formulas require Kelvin for proper calculations. Celsius is convenient but inappropriate for physics.
This converter provides precise temperature conversions for scientific work.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Celsius to Kelvin?
faqs.answer: K = °C + 273.15. Add 273.15 to celsius to get kelvin.

faqs.question: Why use Kelvin in science?
faqs.answer: Kelvin is absolute temperature scale, required for physics calculations and ratios.

faqs.question: What is absolute zero?
faqs.answer: Absolute zero = -273.15°C = 0 K. Lowest possible temperature.

glossary.definition: Temperature scale where water freezes at 0° and boils at 100°.
SI base unit of temperature, absolute scale starting at absolute zero.
